concept.title: Short description
concept.shortdesc: Use natural language for short descriptions, unless doing so would be incredibly awkward.

conbody.p: To check that the short descriptions for a cluster of topics are parallel, generate HTML5 output and look at the link previews. For example:

example.title: Examples of natural-language short descriptions
example.p: Consider the following short descriptions for the steps and cmd elements:
example.lq: Steps are a series of actions that people perform in a specific order and manner.
A command specifies the action that people take to complete a step.

example.title: Examples of short description that do not use natural language
example.p: Consider the following short descriptions for the chhead and choices elements:
example.lq: The chhead element contains elements that provide labels for the columns in a choice table.
The choices element contains a list of choices. Each choice represents a way to complete the current step.
